body.p: Scality RING storage can integrate with Helion's datacenter. Scality provides a block storage interface for OpenStack compute through the Cinder API and integration with OpenStack Swift as an alternative storage back end.
To integrate Scality RING storage with Helion, you must install and configure the following drivers:

li.xref: Install the Scality Driver for Swift
Install the Scality Driver for Glance
Install the Scality Driver for Cinder

section.title: Install the Scality Driver for Swift
section.p: To install the Swift driver, you must complete the following tasks:

ol.li: Update the configuration on the controller nodes
Populate bootstrap entries on the RING storage node

section.title: Download and Extract the Driver
section.p: This procedure steps you through download, conversion, extraction, and compression of the Scality drivers for Swift. This procedure also includes instructions on how to distribute the compressed file to the controller nodes. This must all be completed before continuing with the installation. During this procedure you will need to understand the following concepts:

dlentry.dd: For more details, see Third-party Driver Support.
Virtualenv is something you can use to create an isolated Python development environment. This helps isolate your dependencies, especially when used with pip. For more information, see

ol.li: To create a directory for the driver package, run: cd ~/scratch mkdir pkg

To download and extract the driver, run: cd ~/scratch/pkg wget https://github.com/scality/ScalitySproxydSwift/archive/swift-scality-backend-0.4.0.tar.gz tar xzf swift-scality-backend-0.4.0.tar.gz
wget https://github.com/scality/scality-sproxyd-client/archive/scality-sproxyd-client-0.1.1.tar.gz tar xzf scality-sproxyd-client-0.1.1.tar.gz

To install the 3rd-party driver, first create a specific directory for the file by running:
cd ~/scratch mkdir third-party-wheelhouse

To convert downloaded packages from Python egg to wheel format, run: pip wheel --no-deps convert ./ScalitySproxydSwift-swift-scality-backend-0.4.0/ pip wheel --no-deps convert ./scality-sproxyd-client-scality-sproxyd-client-0.1.1/

To copy the converted files, run: cp wheelhouse/swift_scality_backend-0.4.0-py2-none-any.whl ../third-party-wheelhouse cp wheelhouse/scality_sproxyd_client-0.1.1-py2-none-any.whl ../third-party-wheelhouse
To create a temporary directory for extraction, run: cd ~/scratch mkdir scalitytemp
To create the virtual environment, run: sudo virtualenv scalitytemp
To activate the virtual environment, run: cd ~/scratch/scalitytemp source bin/activate

To install the wheel files using pip, run: sudo pip install ../third-party-wheelhouse/scality_sproxyd_client-0.1.1-py2-none-any.whl sudo pip install ../third-party-wheelhouse/swift_scality_backend-0.4.0-py2-none-any.whl
To go to the installation directory, run: cd /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/
To compress the files into a tar file named scalitydriver.tar, run: sudo tar â€“cvf scalitydriver.tar .
To change the permissions to the default user, run: sudo chown stack:stack scalitydriver.tar

To copy the file to all controller nodes, run: scp scalitydriver.tar stack@10.246.62.6 scp scalitydriver.tar stack@10.246.62.7 scp scalitydriver.tar stack@10.246.62.8 Remember to replace the IP addresses in the example with the ones used in your deployment.
